hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Transition Signal via Options Skew Inversion
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when 25-delta BTC option skew (puts/calls) inverts from negative to positive for 3 consecutive days while price makes marginal new highs (<3% above previous high), this signals exhaustion and high probability of transition to NEUTRAL regime within 5-10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Option skew measures demand for protection. In bull markets, skew is typically negative (calls expensive). Inversion indicates smart money hedging against downturn even as retail chases highs, often preceding consolidation/neutral periods.
entry_conditions: Current regime == BULL with duration > 30 days
BTC 25-delta 30-day option skew flips from negative to positive
BTC price within 3% of 30-day high during skew inversion
Funding rates remain positive but declining (7-day MA down 2+ days)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to NEUTRAL OR 8% price decline from local high
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC breaks to new highs (>5% above previous high) with skew returning negative

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of skew inversions in bull markets lead to immediate acceleration higher (>10% gains in 10 days) rather than neutral transition.
